meanings.sent1: The loud thunderstorm can frighten small children.
meanings.sent2: The sudden noise did frighten the cat.
meanings.sent3: The spooky Halloween decorations might frighten the trick-or-treaters.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence in the abandoned house seemed to frighten even the bravest explorers.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected jump scare in the movie will definitely frighten the audience.

meanings.definition: To cause fear or terror in.
meanings.sent1: The ghost stories around the campfire always frighten the campers.
meanings.sent2: The horror movie was so scary that it could frighten anyone.
meanings.sent3: The haunted house tour guide tried to frighten the visitors with spooky tales.
meanings.sent4: The sinister figure lurking in the shadows could frighten even the toughest detective.
meanings.sent5: The eerie howling of the wind at night can frighten those who are easily scared.
